description:
This is amazing! I've been using Python as a makeshift calculator for so long because it makes it easy to convert between hex/bin/dec and has a bunch of mathemcatical functions built into it - but it is WAY too cumbersome to work with.
This tool incorporates everything that makes using Python great AND makes it soo much more convenient to use!
Thank you for this, sincerely.
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

description: This is actually the best calculator for Linux I could find, not gonna lie. What I like the most is the ability to enter whole expressions with tons of functions supported instead of just doing one operation per time. Also, I was somewhat surprised that it also can convert units and currencies unlike most other calculators. Works perfectly on KDE Plasma, although it seems like it's designed to be DE-independent. Highly configurable as well. Definitely 5 stars!
This should probably be the default calculator for KDE Plasma, it's miles ahead of KCalc.

go into programmer mode, switch to binary. switch back to general mode (at this point you are still in base 2). enter say cbrt(27) or even 27 and check the error "Character '2' was ignored... with base 2) and so on. not sure if bug or feature ;)
A good calculator with lots of options - the simple "delete history"-key is missing though in my opinion or at least I can't find it
This calc is the best, it should be the standard in Ubuntu distro!

Искал калькулятор для KDE, умеющий работать с историей, с константами, формулами. На первый взгляд всё это есть и достаточно удобно в использовании. Интерфейс без привычных калькуляторных кнопок, но это нешает, скорее наоборот, но это, как понимаю, и чуть больше, чем обычный калькулятор.
Советую попробовать.
功能丰富，这个是QT版本，适合KDE桌面
